page.title: 05Cloddach Quarry.
page.content: Cloddach Quarry lies next to the River Lossie, three kilometres from Elgin. The first materials went through the plant in 1971. It makes ready mixed concrete, concrete building blocks and road materials. Lorries are weighed on the weigh bridge to check the amount of sand sold in a year. The employees come from Mosstodloch, Lossiemouth, Fochabers and Elgin. Cloddach Quarry produces 15,000 building blocks a day at 28p each. There are two machines.The first machine takes cement and puts it into a hopper on another machine.This machine vibrates cement into blocks. They started digging at the south end of the deposit. They have found a collection of practice bombs left from the time it was Bogs of Mayne airfield.
